review: This is very fickle.  It has trouble connecting to a WiFi hotspot which is only 5 feet away.  Getting a device to connect to it and show Netflix is hit or miss....  I have had this for 6 months, and rarely use it, because it can take 10 minutes to get connectivity working.  I waited to post my review, hoping a software update might fix intermittent problems.I will say that once streaming begins, it works fine.  However, sometimes it can take 15 minutes to get it connected.  Most frustrating is that frequently after watching a movie and pausing for a while to do other activities, it will lose itself and constantly have to be unplugged and reconfigured for wifi to try to get it working again.
author: Paul Fowler

review: This works very well on any of the numerous sites that support it. Unfortunately Amazon Instant Video has taken the decision to snub the Chromecast which doesn't reflect very well on Amazon. I assume they just want to sell their Fire TV box, but instead I will probably let my Prime member ship lapse especially with the forthcoming price increase.The Chromecast is great because it sits behind the TV out of sight. It gets its power from the TV (USB port) and so it doesn't consume any power when the TV is off. It is easy to control from my iPad or my PC so that I can multitask. Great tool.
